title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 9.167 - Executive Order No. 47.1: Declaring a Disaster Emergency in the State of New York and Ordering Into Active Service the New York National Guard to Assist Authorities in Guaranteeing Public Order and Protection of Public Property at Various Correctional Facilities
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 9.167 - Executive Order No. 47.1: Declaring a Disaster Emergency in the State of New York and Ordering Into Active Service the New York National Guard to Assist Authorities in Guaranteeing Public Order and Protection of Public Property at Various Correctional Facilities

State Regulations
WHEREAS, on February 19, 2025, I issued Executive Order 47
declaring a State Disaster Emergency in the State of New York arising from an
illegal and unlawful strike by correction officers that began on February 17, 2025, and has continued thereafter; NOW THEREFORE, I, Kathy Hochul, by virtue of the authority
vested in me by Section 29-a of Article 2-B of the Executive Law to temporarily
suspend or modify any statute, local law, ordinance, order, rule, or
regulation, or parts thereof, if compliance with such statute, local law, ordinance, order, rule, or regulation would prevent, hinder, or delay action
necessary to cope with the disaster emergency, do hereby amend Executive Order
47 as follows: * The suspension contained in Executive Order 47 of

Sections 134 and 135 of the Civil Service Law is hereby modified to be deemed
effective as of February 17, 2025. (L.S.) GIVEN under my hand and the Privy Seal of the State
in the City of Albany this twenty second day of February in the year two
thousand twenty-five. BY THE GOVERNOR
/S/ Kathy Hochul
/s/ Karen Persichilli Keogh

Secretary to the

Governor

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
9.167

Adopted

New

York State Register March 26, 2025/Volume XLVII, Issue 12, eff. 3/26/2025

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
